00042 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00043 
00044 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00045 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00046 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00047 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00048 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00049 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00050 #define splnone()   rthal_local_irq_enable()
00051 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00052 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00053 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)
00054

00058 typedef struct {
00059 
00060         unsigned long long spin_time;
00061         unsigned long long lock_time;
00062         const char *file;
00063         const char *function;
00064         unsigned line;
00065 
00066 } xnlockinfo_t;
00067 
00068 typedef struct {
00069 
00070     volatile unsigned long lock;
00071     const char *file;
00072     const char *function;
00073     unsigned line;
00074     int cpu;
00075     unsigned long long spin_time;
00076     unsigned long long lock_date;
00077 
00078 } xnlock_t;
00079 
00080 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00081         0,                                      \
00082         NULL,                                   \
00083         NULL,                                   \
00084         0,                                      \
00085         -1,                                     \
00086         0LL,                                    \
00087         0LL,                                    \
00088 }

00157 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00158     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00159 }
00160 
00161 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00162     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00163 }
00164 
00165 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00166     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00167 }
00168 
00169 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00170     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00171 }

00173 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00174     return rthal_processor_id();
00175 }

00181 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00182 do { \
00183     rthal_emergency_console(); \
00184     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00185     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00186     for (;;) cpu_relax();                       \
00187 } while(0)

00189 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00190 
00191 {
00192     spl_t s;
00193     splhigh(s);
00194     splexit(!!imask);
00195     return !!s;
00196 }

00200 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00201 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00202     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00203 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG */
00204 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00205 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG */
00206 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00207 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00208 
00209 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00210 
00211     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00212 }
00213 
00214 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00215 
00216 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00217 
00218 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock,
00219                                           const char *file,
00220                                           unsigned line,
00221                                           const char *function)
00222 {
00223     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00224 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG */
00225 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00226 {
00227 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG */
00228     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00229     unsigned long flags;
00230 
00231     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00232 
00233     rthal_load_cpuid();
00234 
00235     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00236         {
00237 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00238         unsigned long long lock_date = rthal_rdtsc();
00239 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG */
00240         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00241             /* Use an non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00242                bit_spin_lock. */
00243             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00244                 {
00245                 cpu_relax();
00246 
00247 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00248                 if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00249                     {
00250                     rthal_emergency_console();
00251                     printk(KERN_ERR
00252                            "Xenomai: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00253                            "       waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00254                            "       owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00255                            lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00256                            lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00257                     show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00258                     for (;;)
00259                         cpu_relax();
00260                     }
00261 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG */
00262                 }
00263 
00264 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00265         lock->spin_time = rthal_rdtsc() - lock_date;
00266         lock->lock_date = lock_date;
00267         lock->file = file;
00268         lock->function = function;
00269         lock->line = line;
00270         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00271 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG */
00272         }
00273     else
00274         flags |= 2;
00275 
00276     return flags;
00277 }
00278 
00279 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00280 
00281 {
00282     if (!(flags & 2))
00283         {
00284         rthal_declare_cpuid;
00285 
00286         rthal_local_irq_disable();
00287 
00288         rthal_load_cpuid();
00289         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00290             {
00291 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_STATS
00292             extern xnlockinfo_t xnlock_stats[];
00293 
00294             unsigned long long lock_time = rthal_rdtsc() - lock->lock_date;
00295 
00296             if (lock_time > xnlock_stats[cpuid].lock_time)
00297                 {
00298                 xnlock_stats[cpuid].lock_time = lock_time;
00299                 xnlock_stats[cpuid].spin_time = lock->spin_time;
00300                 xnlock_stats[cpuid].file = lock->file;
00301                 xnlock_stats[cpuid].function = lock->function;
00302                 xnlock_stats[cpuid].line = lock->line;
00303                 }
00304 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_STATS */
00305 
00306             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00307             }
00308 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00309         else
00310             {
00311             rthal_emergency_console();
00312             printk(KERN_ERR
00313                    "Xenomai: unlocking unlocked nucleus lock %p\n"
00314                    "       owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00315                    lock,lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00316             show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00317             for (;;)
00318                 cpu_relax();
00319             }
00320 #endif
00321         }
00322 
00323     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00324 }
00325 
00326 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00327 
00328 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00329 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00330 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00331 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_local_irq_disable()
00332 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_local_irq_enable()
00333 
00334 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00340 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00341 
00342     return rthal_send_ipi(RTHAL_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00343 }
00344 
00345 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00346 
00347 {
00348     return rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00349                                 RTHAL_SERVICE_IPI0,
00350                                 (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00351                                 NULL,
00352                                 IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00353 }
00354 
00355 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00356 
00357 {
00358     return rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00359                                 RTHAL_SERVICE_IPI0,
00360                                 NULL,
00361                                 NULL,
00362                                 IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00363 }
00364 
00365 static struct linux_semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00366 
00367 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00368 {
00369     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00370 }
00371 
00372 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00373     
00374 {
00375     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00376     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00377     unsigned long flags;
00378     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00379 
00380     sema_init(&xnarch_finalize_sync,0);
00381 
00382     /* Here rthal_current_domain is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00383        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00384        context. */
00385 
00386     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00387                          RTHAL_SERVICE_IPI2,
00388                          xnarch_finalize_cpu,
00389                          NULL,
00390                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00391 
00392     rthal_lock_cpu(flags);
00393     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00394     rthal_send_ipi(RTHAL_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00395     rthal_unlock_cpu(flags);
00396 
00397     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00398         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00399     
00400     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00401                          RTHAL_SERVICE_IPI2,
00402                          NULL,
00403                          NULL,
00404                          IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00405 }
00406 
00407 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */

00421     return 0;

00424 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00425

00427 
00428 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00429 
00430 {
00431 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00432     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00433        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00434     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00435 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00436 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00437     xnshadow_release_events();
00438 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00439     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00440     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00441     schedule_timeout(50);
00442     xnarch_release_ipi();
00443 }
00444 
00445 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00446 
00447 {
00448     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00449 
00450     if (rthal_current_domain == rthal_root_domain)
00451         {
00452         rthal_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00453         return 1;
00454         }
00455 
00456     return 0;
00457 }
00458 
00459 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00460 
00461 {
00462 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE    
00463     xnshadow_grab_events();
00464 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00465 }

00467 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_sys_time(void)
00468 {
00469     struct timeval tv;
00470     do_gettimeofday(&tv);
00471     return tv.tv_sec * 1000000000ULL + tv.tv_usec * 1000;
00472 }

00523 static inline void xnarch_init_heapcb (xnarch_heapcb_t *hcb)
00524 
00525 {
00526     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00527     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00528     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00529 }

00531 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00532                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00533                                           unsigned long paddr,
00534                                           unsigned long size,
00535                                           pgprot_t prot)
00536 {
00537 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,10)
00538     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00539 #else /* Linux version < 2.6.10 */
00540     return remap_page_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr,size,prot);
00541 #endif /* Linux version >= 2.6.10 */
00542 }
